alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:40PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL RIO ARRIBA COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 139 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Youngsville, or 21 miles northwest of Los Alamos, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Youngsville and Coyote. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
